div1.p: Carter requests a pamphlet on the parallels between Texas cattle fever and yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Rupert Blue, June 30, 1919
div1.opener:
Request for certain book.
H. R. Carter,
Assistant Surgeon General.
/LC
Miscl
Y. F.
(book on)
June 30, 1919.
Surgeon General,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
Sir:
div1.p:
In 1879 or '80, at Cairo, Ills., I found a small book or
pamphlet by Frank Billings, a vetinary surgeon, on the epidem-
iology of the Texas cattle fever, in which he drew a parallel
between it and yellow fever, stating that when the method of
conveyance of one was determined it would give the clew to the
other. I saw this little book again in 1911 when I inspected
Cairo.

If this book can be readily gotten at I would be extremely
glad to see it again. Please advise me.
